CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 27, 1959, pg. 28, reads: "Constable Shows 'Em How - Constable Tommy Smith, popular Hill District political leader, who is always ready to help combat juvenile delinquency, strikes a batting pose for members of the Pirates' baseball team, which he backs in the Hill City Little League, prior to a game with the Cardinals.  Unlike many other adults in the area, Constable Smith not only is a generous financial backer of such projects, but he is never too busy to spend time with his little friends in their quest for wholesome recreation.  Parents consider him an active leader and not a 'lip-service' one in the community. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Little League baseball players and coach wearing Cardinals "Cards" team uniforms, gathered around Constable Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith holding baseball bat, on Kennard Field
